result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael R. Schneider

records.addlTxt: Per Atty Schum, set for Preliminary Hearing

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Assessment of Costs for Blood Draws

Defendant Michael R. Schneider in court.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Binger in court for the State of Wisconsin. Clerk Dana A.  Minutes: SPD has been unable to appoint an attorney for DE for today's hearing. Court holds colloquy with DE re: proceeding pro se or waiving time to allow SPD to appoint an attorney.  DE waives time for preliminary hearing. Court reschedules preliminary hearing to an attorney status hearing.  Bond continued.
Status conference scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Assessment of Costs for Expert Laboratory Analysis and Witness Fees

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM. 
*Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol. *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription. *Not to drive w/o VALID Driver's License.

134PM
Assistant District Attorney Daniel Bernard Deida appeared for the State. Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Benjamin Schwarz. Clerk Dana A. and JT Minutes: Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.Defendant is on a PO Hold.  $5000 Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry). ec
